alert.note: Alert for Clark; Madison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:49PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CLARK AND MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM EDT... At 948 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Springfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Springfield, London, Jefferson, West Jefferson, Mount Sterling, South Charleston, Choctaw Lake, Lake Darby, Harmony, Lisbon, Brighton, Lafayette, South Vienna, Midway, Catawba, Newport, Chenoweth, Hustead, Selma and Madison Lake. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 52 and 84. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 78 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
